byline.contributor: Patricia Torres contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

abstract: Enzo Scarano, Venezuelan politician prohibited from running for office because he filed financial disclosure late, is one of nine opposition candidates in Venezuela that have been barred from ballot for National Assembly election due to bureaucratic technicalities; Venezuela's government, which has been struggling with economic crisis, appears to be using this and other measures to weaken its opposition in coming election in effort to maintain legislative majority.
lead_paragraph: With Venezuela sinking in an economic crisis, raising the prospects of opposition candidates, the government has taken measures to rule several of them ineligible.

headline.main: 9 Opposition Candidates Barred From Venezuela’s December Ballot
headline.print_headline: 9 Opposition Candidates Barred From Venezuela’s December Ballot

snippet: With Venezuela sinking in an economic crisis, raising the prospects of opposition candidates, the government has taken measures to rule several of them ineligible.
